a.title: Budget Notices for local government including the West Noble School Corporation

img.alt: Budget Notices for local government including the West Noble School Corporation
img.title: Budget Notices for local government including the West Noble School Corporation

div.a: WN Continuous Learning Plan

span.p: WN Continuous Learning Plan / Remote Learning (COVID-19) - West Noble School Corporation will deliver high-quality continuous learning opportunities for all students through eLearning. Learning opportunities will be delivered through digital platforms such as Google Classroom, YouTube, Google Meets, Remind, and Class Do Jo. Paper packets will be created and distributed to students for additional enrichment, supplemental class materials, or distance learning if digital learning is not an option for a child's family. Read more.

div.a: How to Handle Chromebook Repairs

span.p: April 7, 2020

In this time of online continuous learning, your West Noble Technology Office would like to address chromebook repairs for all students, grades 2-12. Students, parents/guardians, teachers, or administrators can use this West Noble Chromebook Repair form to report chromebook problems. Because many issues can be resolved remotely, a technician will contact the student or parent/guardian directly with help. If a chromebook or charger is broken, we will schedule a device swap.
The WN Chromebook Repair form is also available from the Coronavirus/COVID-19 page.
All of our school parking lots can be used as hotspots. If close enough to the building, the signal should be available.

div.a: WN School Schedule - Update April 3, 2020

span.p: Good afternoon West Noble. We have received new guidance from the Governor's Office and from the Indiana Department of Education. Face to face instruction in all Indiana Schools has been canceled for the 19-20 school year. However, the DOE is asking us to be sure to conduct at least 160 school days, which means that we at WN will be having 19 E-Learning Dates, starting the Monday after Spring Break. We have completed 141 school days thus far for the 19-20 school year.

E-Learning Days will be Monday, Wednesday, and Friday each week. Assignments for the week will be given on Mondays and are due on Friday of that same week. Teacher office hours are 9-11 and 1-3 daily on Mon, Wed, Fri. The week of May 18-22 is the final week of school. There will be 4 E-Learning days that week (Mon, Tues, Thurs, Fri). The first day of E-Learning is April 13. Our final day is May 22.
Food service will not be handing out meals next week during spring break. That service will resume on the 15th of April. More information will be coming.

div.a: WN Parade

span.p: Just a reminder that you are loved and missed. In case you missed the parade on Tuesday, there were 140 cars filled with your teachers, former teachers, instructional aides, bus drivers, cafeteria workers, custodians, and others who just wanted to see your faces. Here is a very short video highlighting the fact that we miss you.

div.a: Census 2020

span.p: The 2020 Census is happening now! You can respond online using your computer, phone, or tablet. You can also respond by phone or by mail. What are you waiting for? It takes less than 10 minutes. Get started now!
Why is it important to me?

Responding to the census is not only your civic duty; it also affects the amount of funding your community receives, how your community plans for the future, and your representation in government. Specifically, data from the 2020 Census are used to:

ul.li: Ensure public services and funding for schools, hospitals, and fire departments.
Plan new homes and businesses and improve neighborhoods.
Determine how many seats your state is allocated in the House of Representatives.

div.a: 20-21 Kindergarten Pre-Registering

span.p: West Noble Primary Kindergarten Round-Up. Open to all students who will turn 5 on or before October 1, 2020. A date for our 2020 Kindergarten round-Up will be set at a later time. Please continue to check our social media pages as well as our school website for updated information,
Please help us by pre-registering the incoming kindergarten class!!
If you have completed a pre-registration form but haven't turned it in OR never received the form then use the link (Pre-register here!) to pre-register your child.
If you completed a pre-registration form and turned it in to WNP then no further steps are needed.

div.a: Weekend Food Bags - Charger PowerPaks

span.p: March 27, 2020

Charger PowerPaks (weekend food bags) will be distributed every Saturday throughout the remainder of the shutdown period beginning April 4. PowerPaks will be available to any West Noble student in need of weekend food. Food can be picked up at three sites: WN Primary from 10-11:00 am, Eagle's Nest from 11:15 am - 12:00 pm and Stone Ridge Estates from 12:15-1:00 pm. A truck will be parked at the parking lot of WNP, the main building at the front of Eagle's Nest and the old Marathon parking lot of Stone Ridge Estates. PowerPaks are distributed through New Community Initiatives, not West Noble Schools, and will be given on a first come first serve basis.

div.a: Student Wi-Fi Hotspots

span.p: All of our school parking lots can be used as hotspots. If close enough to the building, the signal should be available.
LigtTel Communications has added more Wi-Fi Hotspots for students to use for E-Learning and schoolwork. Please see the attached document for additional information concerning the hotspots.
The new Wi-Fi Hotspot locations are

Wolf Lake Grain & Farm Supply
1644 State Road 109, Albion, IN 46701
North side of the main building (back towards Wolf Lake). Open parking lot area.

Half Acre Cafe
23 State Road 9, Albion, IN 46701
Southwest part of the parking lot. Next to the big telephone pole.

A huge thank you to LigTel Communications. As of today, they have installed several Wi-Fi hotspots at various locations in Noble County where families can take their children and have access to internet service allowing them to complete their work.
Please see the attached document for additional information concerning the hotspots. Parents/students may have additional information via communications with teachers/principals.
